page.title: 03BASILDON NE: EDUCATION
page.content:
When Basildon was first planned, each division of the area was to have its own school. However, as Basildon was the first home for many young people, there was a baby boom, and schools had to be built to accomodate these babies. The result was that schools sprang up all over the place.
The early schools were built with classrooms around a hall, a hard playground and a grassed playing field. These soon became overcrowded and demountable classrooms were installed.
Newer schools are built to the open plan design without any division between classrooms. In this area there are three infant and three junior schools, and one secondary school.
